Articles.Content: Ugh...I'd prefer all versions, tbh, except the MOK (no really, MOK is plain bad and fugly)
Am I the only person who is having the download corrupted when downloading this mod?
Meh, MOK looks good as a launcher 90,000 pounds to 450 kmSSTO.

What's the MOK? Never heard of it.

EDIT: Found an interesting bit on N1, Zond and their competition: http://www.fas.org/irp/imint/94vol47_vick.htm

Edited September 25, 2013 by Guest

What's the MOK? Never heard of it.

N1-MOK was a Kliper type shuttle concept which would have been launched to LEO on an N1 Block A.
Will it be added to the soviet pack or will it be a separate download and I cant wait to fly it
The MOK, or N1?

Please when get this up fast Bobcat. As a inspiring YouTuber your mods ad a polish to the game that makes it such a blast to record.

Also Mir .craft files would be nice I know they were taken out because of ASAS.

Side note #1. The Orion/Altiar lander series. Are you supposed to launch them to LKO seperate? I have been trying to get them staged together like Apollo but always have fuel issues, or I have to add another set of the Boosters.

Side Note #2 The Orion engine comes with fairings, the force of these when decoupled always tear off the solar panels. Could you fix the force?

Side Note #3 .craft files.... lol Where orion, Altiar lander, Cargo, Soyuz and such all have .craft files I am just confused why some you do and some you do not.

Side Note #4 Please do not do the US space shuttle. It is a waste of your talent as so many others have tried and put it out, and honestly I do not find a point to have it.

Your mods really do keep me coming back to this game. I hope you fix some of the issues with the H.O.M.E 2 project.
yeah why would you use a shuttle if you have a buran, anyway...

Please when get this up fast Bobcat. As a inspiring YouTuber your mods ad a polish to the game that makes it such a blast to record.

Side note #1. The Orion/Altiar lander series. Are you supposed to launch them to LKO seperate? I have been trying to get them staged together like Apollo but always have fuel issues, or I have to add another set of the Boosters.

Block V

Block B
Most impressive. Such a pretty piece of engineering - what a pity that the real N-1 failed during all four launches.

Such a pretty piece of engineering

The N-1 is probably the ugliest rocket I have ever seen

I've found it to look more akin to something built by the Orks from Warhammer 40k. Not exactly pretty. But still an amazing feat of engineering, without question.

Edited September 26, 2013 by metalmouth7
Looking nice, Bobbie P.
Wow, I'm very impressed. Handsome work as always Bobcat.

The N-1 is probably the ugliest rocket I have ever seen

De gustibus - Soviet spacecraft have a certain zeerust/raygun rocket appeal and I like this aesthethic Comparing them to Apollo program machines is like comparing Millenium Falcon to TIE Fighter, if you know what I mean.

The N-1 is probably the ugliest rocket I have ever seen

Ah, new to KSP, I assume?
BobCat, are you going to be adding in the Grid Fins to the N1?

Yes, im try make very close replica.

Edited September 26, 2013 by BobCat

Ah, new to KSP, I assume?

No, I been here a while

Woah, Blocks B and A. I love it, it looks so incredible. We'll finally have a high quality N1 with all the bells and whistles. Block B looks more or less done, I guess there's only Block A and SAS left to do, right? Can't wait to play around with it.

Yes, im try make very close replica.

Does the Block A have engine gimbaling? The other mod didn't have it.

Well, it depends on how BobCat wants to do it. The real thing controlled roll via thrusters on Block B (BobCat modeled them, as I see) and 6 inner engines with gimbals. Pitch and yaw were controlled by asymmetric throttling of the main engines, something which KSP can't do, and definitely not with BobCat-style integrated tank+engines. There will probably be a simple gimbal module for entire stages.

Does the Block A have engine gimbaling? The other mod didn't have it.

that's because the real thing didn't have gimblaling, it relied on a computer to change the thrust coming out of the engines on one side for the whole thing to steer
